title: The Woman Who Bailed Out R. Kelly Wants Her Money Back
text:
Photo: Antonio Perez/Getty Images

Back in February, a mysterious person posted $100,000 for R. Kelly’s bail, which was enough of the full $1 million for him to get out of jail at the time. That person was eventually identified as Valencia Love, and now she wants her money back. Love’s lawyer filed a motion in the Cook County Circuit Court last week to try and recover it, but the presiding judge said not today, according to reporting by The Chicago Sun-Times. (It’s possible the money could be returned to her when the court proceedings are finished, but that is potentially years away.) The thing is, though, she’s not turning her back on the singer accused of many rapes and sexual assaults. “At no point have I ever supported a pedophile,” Love told the paper. “He has not been convicted yet. Why is it so bad that I did a favor for a friend?” Kelly, she says, actually paid her back months ago, and that the bail money was just a short term loan while he didn’t have access to his cash. The reason she’s trying to get it now is apparently so she can reinvest it in his defense “to cover his legal costs and other expenses.”

Kelly was able to leave jail after Love bailed him out, but he went back into custody in July after a federal indictment containing charges of child pornography and enticing minors was unsealed. With the disgraced entertainer back behind bars, Love thought the money could come back to her. “Why is it such a big deal? He’s already locked up,” she told the Sun-Times. “Why can’t the bail money be returned?” According to Love’s own lawyer she also put up $50,000 to cover for unpaid child support, but Love, apparently, denies she did so.

Kelly is currently being held in a federal detention center in Chicago. Across indictments in Cook County and New York as well as federal charges (and perhaps also Minnesota), he has been charged with aggravated criminal sexual abuse, racketeering, criminal sexual assault by force, enticing a minor, child pornography, aggravated criminal sexual abuse against a victim between the ages of 13 and 16, and obstruction of justice.
description: Valencia Love, the woman who posted $100,000 to bail R. Kelly out of jail earlier this year, wants to get her money back, but the presiding judge has denied her request.
